titles.en: Chapter 22 – A son of a brother (nephew), and a grandfather

titles.ar: باب الْإِخْوَةِ مِنَ الْأُمِّ مَعَ الْجَدِّ
titles.en: Chapter 21 – The brothers from the mother (half-brothers), with the grandfather
Chapter 22 – A son of a brother (nephew), and a grandfather

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/167)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ نَشَرَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) صَحِيفَةً فَأَوَّلُ مَا تَلَقَّانِي فِيهَا ابْنُ أَخٍ وَ جَدٌّ الْمَالُ بَيْنَهُمَا نِصْفَانِ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنَّ الْقُضَاةَ عِنْدَنَا لَا يَقْضُونَ لِابْنِ الْأَخِ مَعَ الْجَدِّ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ فَقَالَ إِنَّ هَذَا الْكِتَابَ خَطُّ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) وَ إِمْلَاءُ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abu Ayoub, form Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> displayed a parchment, so the first of what faced me in it was a son of a brother (nephew) and a grandfather, then wealth (to be divided) between the two of them is two halves. So I said, ‘The judges with us are not judging with anything being for a son of the brother (nephew) with the grandfather’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This book is written by Ali<sup>asws</sup> and dictated by Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has narrated the following: “Once, abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, made a book available to the public. I found in it that the son of a brother and a grandfather share a legacy in equal shares. I said, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, the judges do not judge for the son of brothers with a grandfather anything.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘This book is in handwriting of Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, as dictated to him by the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/168)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) كَانَ يُوَرِّثُ ابْنَ الْأَخِ مَعَ الْجَدِّ مِيرَاثَ أَبِيهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from Al Qasim Bin Suleyman,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abullah<sup>asws</sup> having said that Ali<sup>asws</sup> would make a son of the brother (nephew) inherit with the grandfather, the inheritance of his father’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad ibn Sulayman who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, would make the son of a brother to inherit the share of his father with a grandfather.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/168)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ عَاصِمِ بْنِ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي جَابِرٌ عَنْ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ لَمْ يُكَذَّبْ [جَابِرٌ] أَنَّ ابْنَ الْأَخِ يُقَاسِمُ الْجَدَّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Najran, from Aasim Bin Humeyd, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Jabir narrated to me<sup>asws</sup> from Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, and he (Jabir) did not lie that a son of the brother (nephew) would be apportioned as the grandfather’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu Najran from ‘Asem ibn Humayd from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has narrated the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that Jabir narrated to me from the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, and he [Jabir] did not lie, that the son of a brother distributes the legacy with a grandfather.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/168)
text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ رَوَى أَبُو شُعَيْبٍ عَنْ رِفَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ ابْنِ أَخٍ وَ جَدٍّ فَقَالَ الْمَالُ بَيْنَهُمَا نِصْفَانِ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from Abu Shuayb, from Rafa’at, from Aban Bin Taghlib,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a son of a brother (nephew), with a grandfather. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The wealth is (divided) between the two of them, two halves’.
en.sarwar: 4. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from al-Hassan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama‘ah who has said that abu Shu’ayb has narrated from Rifa‘ah, from Aban ibn Taghlib who has narrated the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a son of a brother and a grandfather. He (the Imam) said, ‘The legacy between them is half and half.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/168)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ نَظَرْتُ إِلَى صَحِيفَةٍ يَنْظُرُ فِيهَا أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَرَأْتُ فِيهَا مَكْتُوباً ابْنُ أَخٍ وَ جَدٌّ الْمَالُ بَيْنَهُمَا سَوَاءٌ فَقُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ مَنْ عِنْدَنَا لَا يَقْضُونَ بِهَذَا الْقَضَاءِ وَ لَا يَجْعَلُونَ لِابْنِ الْأَخِ مَعَ الْجَدِّ شَيْئاً فَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَمَا إِنَّهُ إِمْلَاءُ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ خَطُّ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) مِنْ فِيهِ بِيَدِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abu Ayoub Al Khazaz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘I looked at a parchment which Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> made me look at, so I read (what was) written in it, a son of a brother (nephew), and a grandfather, the wealth (to be divided) between the two of them, equally. So I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The ones in our presence are not judging by this judgement, nor are they making anything to be for a son of the brother’. So Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But, it was dictated by Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> from his<sup>saww</sup> mouth and written by Ali<sup>asws</sup>, by his<sup>asws</sup> hand’.
en.sarwar: 5. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has narrated the following: “I once looked in a book in which abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was looking and I read therein that a son of a brother and grandfather share the legacy in equal ratios. I then said to abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al- Salam, ‘People around us do not judge with such judgment and they do not give to a son of a brother anything with a grandfather.’ Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said, ‘This is the dictation of the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, in the handwriting of Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, from the mouth of the Messenger of Allah with his (Ali’s) hand.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالموثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/168)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ رَجُلًا يَسْأَلُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَوْ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنَا عِنْدَهُ عَنِ ابْنِ أَخٍ وَ جَدٍّ قَالَ يُجْعَلُ الْمَالُ بَيْنَهُمَا نِصْفَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Abu Al Magra, from Sama’at, from Abu Baseer who said,

‘I heard a man asking Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, or Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and I was in his<sup>asws</sup> presence, about a son of a brother (nephew), and a grandfather. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Make the wealth (to be divided) between the two of them, in two halves’.
en.sarwar: 6. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from abu al-Mighra’ from Sama‘ah from abu Basir who has narrated the following: “I once heard a man asking abu Ja‘far or abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, when I was with him (the Imam), about the son of a brother and a grandfather. He (the Imam) said, ‘The legacy is made half and half between the two of them.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/168)
text: الْفَضْلُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ أَبِي خَلَفٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ فِي بَنَاتِ أُخْتٍ وَ جَدٍّ فَقَالَ لِبَنَاتِ الْأُخْتِ الثُّلُثُ وَ مَا بَقِيَ فَلِلْجَدِّ فَأَقَامَ بَنَاتِ الْأُخْتِ مَقَامَ الْأُخْتِ وَ جَعَلَ الْجَدَّ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الْأَخِ .

en.hubeali: Al Fazl, from Ibn Mahboub, from Sa’ad Bin Abu Khalaf,

(It has been narrated) from one of the companions of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said regarding daughter of a sister, and a grandfather. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘For the daughters of the sister (nieces) is the one-third, and what remains is for the grandfather. So the daughters of the sister (nieces) stand in the place of the sister, and the grandfather is made to be at the status of the brother’.
en.sarwar: 7. Al-Fadl has narrated from ibn Mahbub from Sa‘d ibn abu Khalaf from certain persons of abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, who has narrated the following: “About the case of daughters of a sister and a grandfather, abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘The daughter of a sister receives one-third and the rest is for the grandfather; the daughters of the sister take the place of the sister and have made the grandfather like a brother.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/169)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ امْرَأَةٍ مُمْلَكَةٍ لَمْ يَدْخُلْ بِهَا زَوْجُهَا مَاتَتْ وَ تَرَكَتْ أُمَّهَا وَ أَخَوَيْنِ لَهَا مِنْ أَبِيهَا وَ أُمِّهَا وَ جَدَّهَا أَبَا أُمِّهَا وَ زَوْجَهَا قَالَ يُعْطَى الزَّوْجُ النِّصْفَ وَ تُعْطَى الْأُمُّ الْبَاقِيَ وَ لَا يُعْطَى الْجَدُّ شَيْئاً لِأَنَّ ابْنَتَهُ حَجَبَتْهُ عَنِ الْمِيرَاثِ وَ لَا يُعْطَى الْإِخْوَةُ شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, and a number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, altogether from Ibn Mahboub, from Al Hassan Bin Salih who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about a woman whom her husband had yet to sleep with her, died, and left her mother, and her two brothers from her father and her mother (nephews), and her grandfather being father of her mother, and her husband. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘For the husband is the half, and give the remainder to the mother, and do not give anything to the grandfather, because his daughter blocks him from the inheritance, and the brothers would not be given anything (either)’.
en.sarwar: 8. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad and a number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad all from ibn Mahbub from al-Hassan ibn Salih who has narrated the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a woman who is married, but before going to bed with her husband, has died leaving behind her mother, two brothers from her father and mother and her grandfather, who is the father of her mother, and her husband. He (the Imam) said, ‘The husband receives one-half and the rest belongs to her mother. The grandfather does not receive anything; his daughter bars him from inheritance and brothers do not receive anything.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/169)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ أَبَاهُ وَ عَمَّهُ وَ جَدَّهُ قَالَ فَقَالَ حَجَبَ الْأَبُ الْجَدَّ الْمِيرَاثُ لِلْأَبِ وَ لَيْسَ لِلْعَمِّ وَ لَا لِلْجَدِّ شَيْ‏ءٌ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, from Abu Baseer who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about a man who died and left his father, and his uncle, and his grandfather. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The father blocks the grandfather. The inheritance is for the father and there is nothing for the uncle and the grandfather’.
en.sarwar: 9. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn abu Hamzah from abu Basir who has narrated the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who dies and leaves behind his father, his uncle and grandfather. He (the Imam) said, ‘The father bars the grandfather. The legacy belongs to the father and there is nothing for the uncle and grandfather.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول وآخره مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/169)
text: وَ عَنْهُ وَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) امْرَأَةٌ مَاتَتْ وَ تَرَكَتْ زَوْجَهَا وَ أَبَوَيْهَا أَوْ جَدَّهَا أَوْ جَدَّتَهَا كَيْفَ يُقْسَمُ مِيرَاثُهَا فَوَقَّعَ ( عليه السلام ) لِلزَّوْجِ النِّصْفُ وَ مَا بَقِيَ فَلِلْأَبَوَيْنِ
وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ أَيْضاً أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّ وَ الْجَدَّةَ السُّدُسَ .

en.hubeali: And from him and Ali Bin Abdullah, both together from Ibrahim, from Abdullah Bin Ja’far who said,

‘I wrote to Abu Muhammad<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A woman died and left her husband, and her parent, or her grandfather, or her grandmother. How should her inheritance be distributed?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> signed: ‘For the husband is the half, and what remains, so it is for the two parents’.
And it has also been reported as well that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> provided the one-sixth for the grandfather and the grandmother’.
en.sarwar: 10. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith and Ali ibn ‘Abd Allah all from Ibrahim from ‘Abd Allah ibn Ja‘far who has narrated the following: “I once wrote to abu Muhammad, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and asked that a woman has died leaving behind her husband, her parents or her grandfather or her grandmother; how is the legacy distributed? He (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, signed the answer that said, ‘The share of the husband is one-half and the rest belongs to the parents. It is also narrated that the Messenger of Allah, provided for the grandfather and grandmother one-sixth.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/170)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّةَ السُّدُسَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said that: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> provided the one-sixth for the grandmother’.
en.sarwar: 11. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, provided for the grandmother with one-sixth.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/170)
text: عَنْهُ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّةَ أُمَّ الْأَبِ السُّدُسَ وَ ابْنُهَا حَيٌّ وَ أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّةَ أُمَّ الْأُمِّ السُّدُسَ وَ ابْنَتُهَا حَيَّةٌ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Jameel Bin Darraj,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> provided the grandmother, mother of the father, with the sixth, and her daughter was alive, and provided the grandmother, mother of the mother with the one-sixth, and her daughter was alive’.
en.sarwar: 12. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from Jamil ibn Darraj who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, provided for the grandmother, mother of the father, one-sixth when his son was alive and provided for the grandmother, mother of the mother, one-sixth when her daughter was alive.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/170)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّةَ السُّدُسَ وَ لَمْ يَفْرِضْ لَهَا شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazal, from Ibn Bukeyr, from Zurara,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> provided the grandmother with the one-sixth, and did not Obligate (legislate) anything for her’.
en.sarwar: 13. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from ibn Bukayr from Zurarah who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, provided for the grandmother one-sixth but did not sanction anything for her.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/170)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ نَبِيَّ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَطْعَمَ الْجَدَّةَ السُّدُسَ طُعْمَةً .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazal, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Musa Bin Bakr, from Zurara who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The Prophet<sup>saww</sup> of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> provided the grandmother with the one-sixth as a provision’.
en.sarwar: 14. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from ibn Faddal from ‘Abd Alfah ibn af-Mughirah from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurarah who has narrated the foffowing: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ‘The Holy Prophet, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, provided for the grandmother one-sixth as food.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/171)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ أَبِي خَلَفٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ عِنْدَهُ أَبَانُ بْنُ تَغْلِبَ فَقُلْتُ أَصْلَحَكَ اللَّهُ إِنَّ ابْنَتِي هَلَكَتْ وَ أُمِّي حَيَّةٌ فَقَالَ أَبَانٌ لَيْسَ لِأُمِّكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ أَعْطِهَا السُّدُسَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Sa’ad Bin Abu Khalaf, from Abdul Rahman Bin Abu Abdullah, said,

‘I came over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> and in his<sup>asws</sup> presence was Aban Bin Taghlub. So I said, ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Keep you well! My daughter died and my mother is alive’. So Aban said, ‘There is nothing for your mother’. So Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Glory be to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Give her the one-sixth!’
en.sarwar: 15. Afi ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Sa‘d ibn abu Khalaf from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn abu ‘Abd Allah who has narrated the following: “I once visited abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, when Aban ibn Taghlib was with him (the Imam) and I said, ‘I pray to Allah to keep you well, my daughter has died and my mother is alive.’ Aban said, ‘There is nothing for your mother.’ Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said, ‘Allah is free of all defects, give her one-sixth.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/171)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَنْصُورٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا اجْتَمَعَ أَرْبَعُ جَدَّاتٍ ثِنْتَيْنِ مِنْ قِبَلِ الْأُمِّ وَ ثِنْتَيْنِ مِنْ قِبَلِ الْأَبِ طُرِحَتْ وَاحِدَةٌ مِنْ قِبَلِ الْأُمِّ بِالْقُرْعَةِ فَكَانَ السُّدُسُ بَيْنَ الثَّلَاثَةِ وَ كَذَلِكَ إِذَا اجْتَمَعَ أَرْبَعَةُ أَجْدَادٍ أُسْقِطَ وَاحِدٌ مِنْ قِبَلِ الْأُمِّ بِالْقُرْعَةِ وَ كَانَ السُّدُسُ بَيْنَ الثَّلَاثَةِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, form Ali Bin Asbat, from Ismail Bin Mansour, from one of his companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When four grandmothers gather together, two from the direction of the mother, and two from the direction of the father, one is left out from the direction of the mother with the drawing of lots, so the one-sixth would be between the three. And similar to that, when four grandfathers are gathered together, one is dropped from the direction of the mother with the drawing of lots, and that the one-sixth would be between the three’.
en.sarwar: 16. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn Asbat from ’Isma‘il ibn Mansur from certain persons of his people who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When four grandmothers come together, two from the side of the mother and two from the side of the father, one by means of raffle is reduced from the side of the mother, then one-sixth will be distributed among the three. Also if four grandfathers come together, one by means of raffle is reduced from the side of the mother, and the one-sixth is distributed among the three.’” [Note: The next several pages of the Arabic text are the words of our scholars and are not translated.]
